title: "Maximum update depth exceeded" with single, simple functional component
body:
X-post from https://stackoverflow.com/questions/54081088/react-webpack-and-tampermonkey-cannot-set-property-event-of-object-which, since this seems to be centered in React. **Do you want to request a *feature* or report a *bug*?** A bug. **What is the current behavior?** Receiving "maximum update depth exceeded" while rendering a single functional component without any lifecycle methods. **If the current behavior is a bug, please provide the steps to reproduce and if possible a minimal demo of the problem. Your bug will get fixed much faster if we can run your code and it doesn't have dependencies other than React. Paste the link to your JSFiddle (https://jsfiddle.net/Luktwrdm/) or CodeSandbox (https://codesandbox.io/s/new) example below:** I am unsure how I could adequately reproduce this environment in a sandbox. The code is being transpiled with webpack/babel, but is exactly as follows: ``` import React from 'react'; import ReactDOM from 'react-dom'; console.log("webpacked script is working!"); const Hello = () =>
hello
const graph = document.querySelector('a[href*="url_here"]'); console.log(graph); ReactDOM.render(, graph); ``` The error message screenshot: ![screen shot 2019-01-07 at 3 01 21 pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22137047/50793151-4b0bc380-1295-11e9-9a3d-d100496562e9.png) **What is the expected behavior?** The `` component should render into the DOM. **Which versions of React, and which browser / OS are affected by this issue? Did this work in previous versions of React?** This is React 16.6.3. Have not attempted in previous versions.
